thread.title: Nationals ace Scherzer pitching no-hitter thru 8 vs Mets
thread.title_full: Nationals ace Scherzer pitching no-hitter thru 8 vs Mets

title: Nationals ace Scherzer pitching no-hitter thru 8 vs Mets
text:
Updated: 9:17 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015 | Posted: 9:16 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015 Nationals ace Scherzer pitching no-hitter thru 8 vs Mets Related Washington Nationals starter Max Scherzer (31) pitches against the New York Mets in the first inning of the second baseball game of a doubleheader, Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Kmonicek) Sponsored Links The Associated Press NEW YORK â€” 
Washington Nationals ace Max Scherzer is pitching a no-hitter through eight innings against the New York Mets. 
Scherzer already has thrown a no-hitter this season, in June against Pittsburgh. 
The NL East champion Mets haven't come close to a hit off Scherzer. He has struck out his last seven batters and 15 overall without a walk. 
The Mets' only runner reached on a throwing error by third baseman Yunel Escobar on Kevin Plawecki's leadoff grounder in the sixth. 
Scherzer has thrown 93 pitches on a brisk, blustery night at Citi Field in the second game of a day-night doubleheader. Washington leads 2-0. 
This was the fifth time this season that Scherzer took a no-hit bid into the sixth inning. The 2013 AL Cy Young winner with Detroit is in his first year with the Nationals. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WHIO-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
